headline: You Only Need $500,000 To Retire If You Follow Vincent Chan's Framework: 'The Less Money You Spend, The Earlier You Can Retire'
summary: Financial personality Vincent Chan recently laid out how to retire with a $500,000 portfolio. It may sound counterintuitive to walk away from work with less than $1 million saved up, but it becomes more feasible when considering withdrawal rates, asset growth rates, and other income sources. "The less money you spend, the earlier you can retire," Chan said in a video on his YouTube channel. headline: Tencent and GIC-Backed Joint Venture in China Could Be a Game Changer for Starbucks (SBUX)
summary: Earlier this month, Boyu Capital entered advanced discussions to secure backing from Tencent and Singapore’s GIC as limited partners in its planned acquisition of a majority US$4 billion stake in Starbucks' China retail operations, forming a new joint venture in which Starbucks will retain a 40% stake and continue to own the brand's intellectual property. This move reflects a trend of international consumer brands seeking local partnerships to solidify their competitive position in the...
